channel.title: Ipconfig error :/
channel.description: I was about to portforward my server... so I hit "Ipconfig" in my start menu, and... it opened just fine when i found it, for about .3 of a second, and then it closed down on it's own, with no prevocation. It didn't even stay up for a long enough time to see what I needed to see. Could someone help me fix this please? :) Rep++ definately.

item.title: Ipconfig error :/
item.dc:creator: @Tempest_Gaia Tempest Gaia
item.description:
@Tempest_Gaia wrote:

Thx for the help anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipconfig error :/
item.dc:creator: @dgk_all_day1 dgk_all_day
item.description:
@dgk_all_day1 wrote:

Tempest Gaia:

I was about to portforward my server… so I hit “Ipconfig” in my start menu, and… it opened just fine when i found it, for about .3 of a second, and then it closed down on it’s own, with no prevocation. It didn’t even stay up for a long enough time to see what I needed to see. Could someone help me fix this please? Rep++ definately.

wow dude i had the exact same problem till i figured it out =p

what your doing atm is start>run>ipconfig which is wrong that will open it then close it what you need to do is this - start>run>cmd>ipconfig then it will work =p

probably already fixed this but il jsut reply anyway was doing my head in about 30minutes ago

Read full topic

item.title: Ipconfig error :/
item.dc:creator: @Tempest_Gaia Tempest Gaia
item.description:
@Tempest_Gaia wrote:

Sorry gentlemen, I should have locked the topic, because I had an idea of innovation : Record it with hypercam, then freezeframe to get the information I required, anyway, thank you for your good intent.

item.title: Ipconfig error :/
item.dc:creator: @revjester revjester
item.description:
@revjester wrote:

asshole_rule:

open cmd prompt and type in ipconfig instead.

If his method does the same thing restart your computer.
